page.title: 02CARTERTON. A GROWING TOWN
page.content: {Carterton}began as a small {market {gardening community}famous for its tomatoes. The arrival of the airfield led naturally to growth but the rapid development of the last decade is probably due to the demand for more housing in the {Oxford }and {Witney } area. House building has outstripped the development of shopping and recreational facilities and the town council is working to achieve a balance.More shops are planned and recreation areas are being sought but space around the town centre is limited. The townspeople want their own fire station,better policing and it is hoped to provide more for the youth of the area as they have no meeting places apart from the youth club.The town council is also pressing for better road links in the hope of attracting industry to the area.
